papers.title: Automated Attack Discovery in TCP Congestion Control Using a Model-guided Approach
papers.authors: Samuel Jero, Md. Endadul Hoque, David R. Choffnes, Alan Mislove, Cristina Nita-Rotaru
papers.abstract: In this work, we propose an automated method to find attacks against TCP congestion control implementations that combines the generality of implementation-agnostic fuzzing with the precision of runtime analysis. It uses a model-guided approach to generate abstract attack strategies by leveraging a state machine model of congestion control to find vulnerable state machine paths that an attacker could exploit to increase or decrease the throughput of a connection. These abstract strategies are then mapped to concrete attack strategies, which consist of sequences of actions such as injection or modification of acknowledgements. We design and implement a virtualized platform, TCPwn, that consists of a proxy-based attack injector to inject these concrete attack strategies. We evaluated 5 TCP implementations from 4 Linux distributions and Windows 8.1. Overall, we found 11 classes of attacks, of which 8 are new.
papers.abstract_zh: 在这项工作中，我们提出了一种自动的方法来发现针对TCP拥塞控制实现的攻击，该方法结合了与实现无关的模糊化的一般性和运行时分析的精确性。它使用模型引导的方法来生成抽象的攻击策略，通过利用拥塞控制的状态机模型来查找易受攻击的状态机路径，攻击者可以利用这些路径来增加或减少连接的吞吐量。然后，这些抽象策略被映射到具体的攻击策略，这些攻击策略由一系列动作组成，例如注入或修改确认。我们设计并实现了一个虚拟化平台TCPwn，它由一个基于代理的攻击注入器组成，用来注入这些具体的攻击策略。我们评估了来自4个Linux发行版和Windows 8.1的5个TCP实现。总体而言，我们发现了11类攻击，其中8类是新的。
papers.title_zh: 使用模型引导方法的TCP拥塞控制中的自动攻击发现

papers.title: Preventing (Network) Time Travel with Chronos
papers.authors: Omer Deutsch, Neta Rozen Schiff, Danny Dolev, Michael Schapira
papers.abstract: The Network Time Protocol (NTP) synchronizes time across computer systems over the Internet. Unfortunately, NTP is highly vulnerable to "time shifting attacks", in which the attacker's goal is to shift forward/backward the local time at an NTP client. This has severe implications for the correctness and safety of time-sensitive applications and for security mechanisms. Importantly, time shifting attacks on NTP are possible even if all NTP communications are encrypted and authenticated. We present Chronos, a new NTP client that achieves good synchronization even in the presence of powerful man-in-the-middle attackers. Chronos is backwards compatible with legacy NTP and involves no changes whatsoever to NTP servers. In addition, Chronos is carefully engineered to minimize communication overhead so as to avoid overloading NTP servers. We evaluate Chronos' security and network efficiency guarantees via a combination of theoretical analyses and experiments with a prototype implementation. Our results indicate that to succeed in shifting time at a Chronos client by over 100ms from the UTC, even a powerful man-in-the-middle attacker requires over 20 years of effort in expectation. Based on work published at [1].
papers.abstract_zh: 网络时间协议(NTP)通过互联网同步计算机系统的时间。不幸的是，NTP极易受到“时移攻击”，在这种攻击中，攻击者的目标是向前/向后移动NTP客户端的本地时间。这对时间敏感的应用程序和安全机制的正确性和安全性有严重的影响。重要的是，即使所有NTP通信都经过加密和身份验证，对NTP的时移攻击也是可能的。我们介绍了Chronos，这是一种新的NTP客户端，即使在存在强大的中间人攻击者的情况下也能实现良好的同步。Chronos向后兼容传统的NTP，不涉及对NTP服务器的任何更改。此外，Chronos经过精心设计，最大限度地减少了通信开销，以避免NTP服务器过载。我们通过结合理论分析和原型实现的实验来评估Chronos的安全性和网络效率保证。我们的结果表明，要成功地将Chronos客户端的时间从UTC移动超过100毫秒，即使是强大的中间人攻击者也需要20多年的努力。基于在[1]发表的工作。
papers.title_zh: 使用Chronos防止(网络)时间旅行

papers.title: LTEInspector: A Systematic Approach for Adversarial Testing of 4G LTE
papers.authors: Syed Rafiul Hussain, Omar Chowdhury, Shagufta Mehnaz, Elisa Bertino
papers.abstract: In this paper, we investigate the security and privacy of the three critical procedures of the 4G LTE protocol (i.e., attach, detach, and paging), and in the process, uncover potential design aws of the protocol and unsafe practices employed by the stakeholders. For exposing vulnerabilities, we propose a modelbased testing approachLTEInspector which lazily combines a symbolic model checker and a cryptographic protocol veri er in the symbolic attacker model. Using LTEInspector, we have uncovered 10 new attacks along with 9 prior attacks, categorized into three abstract classes (i.e., security, user privacy, and disruption of service), in the three procedures of 4G LTE. Notable among our ndings is the authentication relay attackthat enables an adversary to spoof the location of a legitimate user to the core network without possessing appropriate credentials. To ensure that the exposed attacks pose real threats and are indeed realizable in practice, we have validated8 of the 10 new attacks and their accompanying adversarial assumptions through experimentation in a real testbed.
papers.abstract_zh: 在本文中，我们调查了4G LTE协议的三个关键过程(即连接、分离和寻呼)的安全性和隐私性，并在此过程中揭示了协议的潜在设计aws和利益相关方采用的不安全做法。为了暴露漏洞，我们提出了一种基于模型的测试方法Inspector，它在符号攻击者模型中惰性地结合了符号模型检查器和密码协议验证器。使用LTEInspector，我们在4G LTE的三个过程中发现了10种新攻击和9种以前的攻击，分为三个抽象类别(即安全、用户隐私和服务中断)。在我们的发现中，值得注意的是认证中继攻击，它使对手能够在不拥有适当凭证的情况下将合法用户的位置欺骗到核心网络。为了确保暴露的攻击构成真正的威胁并且在实践中确实是可实现的，我们已经通过在真实测试床上的实验验证了10种新攻击中的8种及其伴随的敌对假设。
papers.title_zh: LTE inspector:4G LTE对抗测试的系统方法

papers.title: GUTI Reallocation Demystified: Cellular Location Tracking with Changing Temporary Identifier
papers.authors: Byeongdo Hong, Sangwook Bae, Yongdae Kim
papers.abstract: To keep subscribers’ identity confidential, a cellular network operator must use a temporary identifier instead of a permanent one according to the 3GPP standard. Temporary identifiers include Temporary Mobile Subscriber Identity (TMSI) and Globally Unique Temporary Identifier (GUTI) for GSM/3G and Long-Term Evolution (LTE) networks, respectively. Unfortunately, recent studies have shown that carriers fail to protect subscribers in both GSM/3G and LTE mainly because these identifiers have static and persistent values. These identifiers can be used to track subscribers’ locations. These studies have suggested that temporary identifiers must be reallocated frequently to solve this privacy problem. The only mechanism to update the temporary identifier in current LTE implementations is called GUTI reallocation. We investigate whether the current implementation of the GUTI reallocation mechanism can provide enough security to protect subscribers’ privacy. To do this, we collect data by performing GUTI reallocation more than 30,000 times with 28 carriers across 11 countries using 78 SIM cards. Then, we investigate whether (1) these reallocated GUTIs in each carrier show noticeable patterns and (2) if they do, these patterns are consistent among different SIM cards within each carrier. Among 28 carriers, 19 carriers have easily predictable and consistent patterns in their GUTI reallocation mechanisms. Among the remaining 9 carriers, we revisit 4 carriers to investigate them in greater detail. For all these 4 carriers, we could find interesting yet predictable patterns after invoking GUTI reallocation multiple times within a short time period. By using this predictability, we show that an adversary can track subscribers’ location as in previous studies. Finally, we present a lightweight and unpredictable GUTI reallocation mechanism as a solution.
papers.abstract_zh: 根据3GPP标准，为了对用户身份保密，蜂窝网络运营商必须使用临时标识符，而不是永久标识符。临时标识符包括分别用于GSM/3G和长期演进(LTE)网络的临时移动订户身份(TMSI)和全球唯一临时标识符(GUTI)。不幸的是，最近的研究表明，运营商无法保护GSM/3G和LTE中的用户，主要是因为这些标识符具有静态和持久的值。这些标识符可以用来跟踪用户的位置。这些研究表明，临时标识符必须经常重新分配，以解决这个隐私问题。在当前LTE实现中更新临时标识符的唯一机制被称为GUTI重新分配。我们研究了GUTI再分配机制的当前实现是否能够提供足够的安全性来保护用户的隐私。为此，我们使用78张SIM卡，在11个国家的28家运营商中进行了30，000多次GUTI再分配，以此来收集数据。然后，我们调查(1)每个运营商中这些重新分配的GUTIs是否显示出明显的模式，以及(2)如果它们显示出，这些模式在每个运营商中的不同SIM卡之间是否一致。在28个运营商中，19个运营商在其GUTI再分配机制中具有容易预测和一致的模式。在剩余的9个载体中，我们再次访问了4个载体以更详细地研究它们。对于所有这4个运营商，在短时间内多次调用GUTI再分配后，我们可以发现有趣且可预测的模式。通过使用这种可预测性，我们表明对手可以像以前的研究一样跟踪用户的位置。最后，我们提出了一个轻量级和不可预测的GUTI再分配机制作为解决方案。
papers.title_zh: GUTI再分配揭秘:具有变化的临时标识符的蜂窝位置跟踪

papers.title: Mind Your Keys? A Security Evaluation of Java Keystores
papers.authors: Riccardo Focardi, Francesco Palmarini, Marco Squarcina, Graham Steel, Mauro Tempesta
papers.abstract: Cryptography is complex and variegate and requires to combine different algorithms and mechanisms in nontrivial ways. This complexity is often source of vulnerabilities. Secure key management is one of the most critical aspects, since leaking a cryptographic key vanishes any advantage of using cryptography. In this paper we analyze Java keystores, the standard way to manage and securely store keys in Java applications. We consider seven keystore implementations from Oracle JDK and Bouncy Castle, a widespread cryptographic library. We describe, in detail, how the various keystores enforce confidentiality and integrity of the stored keys through passwordbased cryptography and we show that many of the implementations do not adhere to state-of-the-art cryptographic standards. We investigate the resistance to offline attacks and we show that, for non-compliant keystores, brute-forcing can be up to three orders of magnitude faster with respect to the most compliant keystore. Additionally, when an attacker can tamper with the keystore file, some implementations are vulnerable to denial of service attacks or, in the worst case, arbitrary code execution. Finally we discuss the fixes implemented by Oracle and Bouncy Castle developers following our responsible disclosure.
papers.abstract_zh: 密码学是复杂多样，需要以非平凡的方式组合不同的算法和机制。这种复杂性通常是漏洞的来源。安全的密钥管理是最关键的方面之一，因为密钥泄露会使使用加密技术的任何优势消失。在本文中，我们分析了Java密钥库，它是在Java应用程序中管理和安全存储密钥的标准方法。我们考虑来自Oracle JDK和Bouncy Castle(一个广泛使用的加密库)的七个密钥库实现。我们详细描述了各种密钥库如何通过基于密码的加密来加强所存储密钥的机密性和完整性，并且我们表明许多实现并不符合最先进的加密标准。我们研究了对离线攻击的抵抗力，并且我们表明，对于不兼容的密钥库，暴力破解可以比最兼容的密钥库快三个数量级。此外，当攻击者能够篡改密钥库文件时，一些实现容易受到拒绝服务攻击，或者在最坏的情况下，执行任意代码。最后，我们讨论Oracle和Bouncy Castle开发人员在我们负责任的披露之后实施的修复。
papers.title_zh: 小心你的钥匙。Java密钥库的安全性评估

papers.title: A Security Analysis of Honeywords
papers.authors: Ding Wang, Haibo Cheng, Ping Wang, Jeff Yan, Xinyi Huang
papers.abstract: Honeywords are decoy passwords associated with each user account, and they contribute a promising approach to detecting password leakage. This approach was first proposed by Juels and Rivest at CCS’13, and has been covered by hundreds of medias and also adopted in various research domains. The idea of honeywords looks deceptively simple, but it is a deep and sophisticated challenge to automatically generate honeywords that are hard to differentiate from real passwords. In JuelsRivest’s work, four main honeyword-generation methods are suggested but only justified by heuristic security arguments. In this work, we for the first time develop a series of practical experiments using 10 large-scale datasets, a total of 104 million real-world passwords, to quantitatively evaluate the security that these four methods can provide. Our results reveal that they all fail to provide the expected security: real passwords can be distinguished with a success rate of 29.29%∼32.62% by our basic trawling-guessing attacker, but not the expected 5%, with just one guess (when each user account is associated with 19 honeywords as recommended). This figure reaches 34.21%∼49.02% under the advanced trawling-guessing attackers who make use of various state-of-the-art probabilistic password models. We further evaluate the security of Juels-Rivest’s methods under a targeted-guessing attacker who can exploit the victim’ personal information, and the results are even more alarming: 56.81%∼67.98%. Overall, our work resolves three open problems in honeyword research, as defined by Juels and Rivest.
papers.abstract_zh: 蜜语是与每个用户帐户相关联的诱饵密码，它们为检测密码泄露提供了一种有前途的方法。这种方法最早是由Juels和Rivest在CCS'13上提出的，已经被数百家媒体报道，并被各种研究领域采用。甜言蜜语的想法看似简单，但自动生成难以与真实密码区分的甜言蜜语是一个深刻而复杂的挑战。在JuelsRivest的工作中，提出了四种主要的甜言蜜语生成方法，但只能通过启发式安全论证来证明。在这项工作中，我们首次开发了一系列实际实验，使用10个大规模数据集，总共1.04亿个真实世界的密码，来定量评估这四种方法可以提供的安全性。我们的结果显示，它们都无法提供预期的安全性:我们的基本拖网猜测攻击者可以以29.29%∞32.62%的成功率区分真实密码，但不是预期的5%，只需一次猜测(当每个用户帐户与19个推荐的蜜语相关联时)。在使用各种先进的概率密码模型的高级拖网猜测攻击者的情况下，这个数字达到34.21%∞49.02%。我们进一步评估了Juels-Rivest方法在一个可以利用受害者个人信息的定向猜测攻击者下的安全性，结果更加惊人:56.81%∞67.98%。总的来说，我们的工作解决了Juels和Rivest定义的蜜语研究中的三个公开问题。
papers.title_zh: 蜜网的安全性分析

papers.title: Revisiting Private Stream Aggregation: Lattice-Based PSA
papers.authors: Daniela Becker, Jorge Guajardo, Karl-Heinz Zimmermann
papers.abstract: In this age of massive data gathering for purposes of personalization, targeted ads, etc. there is an increased need for technology that allows for data analysis in a privacy-preserving manner. Private Stream Aggregation as introduced by Shi et al. (NDSS 2011) allows for the execution of aggregation operations over privacy-critical data from multiple data sources without placing trust in the aggregator and while maintaining differential privacy guarantees. We propose a generic PSA scheme, LaPS, based on the Learning With Error problem, which allows for a flexible choice of the utilized privacy-preserving mechanism while maintaining post-quantum security. We overcome the limitations of earlier schemes by relaxing previous assumptions in the security model and provide an efficient and compact scheme with high scalability. Our scheme is practical, for a plaintext space of 2 and 1000 participants we achieve a performance gain in decryption of roughly 150 times compared to previous results in Shi et al. (NDSS 2011).
papers.abstract_zh: 在这个为个性化、定向广告等目的收集大量数据的时代。越来越需要允许以保护隐私的方式进行数据分析的技术。Shi等人(2011)提出的私有流聚合允许在不信任聚合器的情况下对来自多个数据源的隐私关键数据执行聚合操作，同时保持不同的隐私保证。基于错误学习问题，我们提出了一个通用的PSA方案LaPS，它允许灵活选择所使用的隐私保护机制，同时保持后量子安全性。我们通过放松安全模型中先前的假设来克服早期方案的限制，并提供了一个高效和紧凑的具有高可扩展性的方案。我们的方案是实用的，对于2个和1000个参与者的明文空间，我们在解密方面实现了大约150倍的性能增益，与史等人(2011)的先前结果相比。
papers.title_zh: 重新审视私有流聚合:基于格的PSA

papers.title: ZeroTrace : Oblivious Memory Primitives from Intel SGX
papers.authors: Sajin Sasy, Sergey Gorbunov, Christopher W. Fletcher
papers.abstract: We are witnessing a confluence between applied cryptography and secure hardware systems in enabling secure cloud computing. On one hand, work in applied cryptography has enabled efficient, oblivious data-structures and memory primitives. On the other, secure hardware and the emergence of Intel SGX has enabled a low-overhead and mass market mechanism for isolated execution. By themselves these technologies have their disadvantages. Oblivious memory primitives carry high performance overheads, especially when run non-interactively. Intel SGX, while more efficient, suffers from numerous softwarebased side-channel attacks, high context switching costs, and bounded memory size. In this work we build a new library of oblivious memory primitives, which we call ZeroTrace. ZeroTrace is designed to carefully combine state-of-the-art oblivious RAM techniques and SGX, while mitigating individual disadvantages of these technologies. To the best of our knowledge, ZeroTrace represents the first oblivious memory primitives running on a real secure hardware platform. ZeroTrace simultaneously enables a dramatic speed-up over pure cryptography and protection from softwarebased side-channel attacks. The core of our design is an efficient and flexible block-level memory controller that provides oblivious execution against any active software adversary, and across asynchronous SGX enclave terminations. Performance-wise, the memory controller can service requests for 4 B blocks in 1.2 ms and 1 KB blocks in 3.4 ms (given a 10 GB dataset). On top of our memory controller, we evaluate Set/Dictionary/List interfaces which can all perform basic operations (e.g., get/put/insert).
papers.abstract_zh: 我们正在见证应用密码学和安全硬件系统在实现安全云计算方面的融合。一方面，应用密码学的工作已经实现了高效的、不经意的数据结构和内存原语。另一方面，安全硬件和SGX的出现为隔离执行提供了低开销和大众市场机制。这些技术本身有其缺点。遗忘内存原语会带来很高的性能开销，尤其是在非交互运行时。SGX虽然效率更高，但会遭受大量基于软件的旁道攻击、高上下文切换成本和有限的内存大小。在这项工作中，我们建立了一个新的遗忘内存原语库，我们称之为ZeroTrace。ZeroTrace旨在将最先进的不经意RAM技术和SGX仔细结合起来，同时减轻这些技术各自的缺点。据我们所知，ZeroTrace代表了第一个在真正安全的硬件平台上运行的不经意内存原语。ZeroTrace同时实现了相对于纯加密的显著加速和对基于软件的旁路攻击的保护。我们设计的核心是一个高效、灵活的块级内存控制器，它能够针对任何活跃的软件对手，跨异步SGX飞地终端提供无意识的执行。就性能而言，内存控制器可以在1.2毫秒内处理4 B数据块请求，在3.4毫秒内处理1 KB数据块请求(假设数据集为10 GB)。在我们的内存控制器之上，我们评估Set/Dictionary/List接口，它们都可以执行基本操作(例如，get/put/insert)。
papers.title_zh: ZeroTrace:英特尔SGX的遗忘内存原语

papers.title: Automated Website Fingerprinting through Deep Learning
papers.authors: Vera Rimmer, Davy Preuveneers, Marc Juárez, Tom van Goethem, Wouter Joosen
papers.abstract: Several studies have shown that the network traffic that is generated by a visit to a website over Tor reveals information specific to the website through the timing and sizes of network packets. By capturing traffic traces between users and their Tor entry guard, a network eavesdropper can leverage this meta-data to reveal which website Tor users are visiting. The success of such attacks heavily depends on the particular set of traffic features that are used to construct the fingerprint. Typically, these features are manually engineered and, as such, any change introduced to the Tor network can render these carefully constructed features ineffective. In this paper, we show that an adversary can automate the feature engineering process, and thus automatically deanonymize Tor traffic by applying our novel method based on deep learning. We collect a dataset comprised of more than three million network traces, which is the largest dataset of web traffic ever used for website fingerprinting, and find that the performance achieved by our deep learning approaches is comparable to known methods which include various research efforts spanning over multiple years. The obtained success rate exceeds 96% for a closed world of 100 websites and 94% for our biggest closed world of 900 classes. In our open world evaluation, the most performant deep learning model is 2% more accurate than the state-of-the-art attack. Furthermore, we show that the implicit features automatically learned by our approach are far more resilient to dynamic changes of web content over time. We conclude that the ability to automatically construct the most relevant traffic features and perform accurate traffic recognition makes our deep learning based approach an efficient, flexible and robust technique for website fingerprinting.
papers.abstract_zh: 几项研究表明，通过Tor访问网站所产生的网络流量通过网络数据包的时间和大小揭示了特定于该网站的信息。通过捕获用户与其Tor入口防护之间的流量跟踪，网络窃听者可以利用这些元数据来揭示Tor用户正在访问的网站。此类攻击的成功在很大程度上取决于用于构建指纹的特定流量特征集。通常，这些功能是手动设计的，因此，对Tor网络的任何更改都会使这些精心构建的功能失效。在本文中，我们展示了对手可以自动化特征工程过程，从而通过应用我们基于深度学习的新方法来自动去噪Tor流量。我们收集了一个由超过300万个网络轨迹组成的数据集，这是有史以来用于网站指纹识别的最大的web流量数据集，并发现我们的深度学习方法所实现的性能与已知方法相当，这些方法包括跨越多年的各种研究工作。对于100个网站的封闭世界，获得的成功率超过96%，对于我们最大的900个类的封闭世界，获得的成功率超过94%。在我们的开放世界评估中，性能最高的深度学习模型比最先进的攻击精确2%。此外，我们表明，通过我们的方法自动学习的隐含特征对web内容随时间的动态变化更具弹性。我们的结论是，自动构建最相关的流量特征并执行准确的流量识别的能力使我们基于深度学习的方法成为一种高效、灵活和稳健的网站指纹技术。
papers.title_zh: 通过深度学习实现自动化网站指纹识别

papers.title: VulDeePecker: A Deep Learning-Based System for Vulnerability Detection
papers.authors: Zhen Li, Deqing Zou, Shouhuai Xu, Xinyu Ou, Hai Jin, Sujuan Wang, Zhijun Deng, Yuyi Zhong
papers.abstract: The automatic detection of software vulnerabilities is an important research problem. However, existing solutions to this problem rely on human experts to define features and often miss many vulnerabilities (i.e., incurring high false negative rate). In this paper, we initiate the study of using deep learning-based vulnerability detection to relieve human experts from the tedious and subjective task of manually defining features. Since deep learning is motivated to deal with problems that are very different from the problem of vulnerability detection, we need some guiding principles for applying deep learning to vulnerability detection. In particular, we need to find representations of software programs that are suitable for deep learning. For this purpose, we propose using code gadgets to represent programs and then transform them into vectors, where a code gadget is a number of (not necessarily consecutive) lines of code that are semantically related to each other. This leads to the design and implementation of a deep learning-based vulnerability detection system, called Vulnerability Deep Pecker (VulDeePecker). In order to evaluate VulDeePecker, we present the first vulnerability dataset for deep learning approaches. Experimental results show that VulDeePecker can achieve much fewer false negatives (with reasonable false positives) than other approaches. We further apply VulDeePecker to 3 software products (namely Xen, Seamonkey, and Libav) and detect 4 vulnerabilities, which are not reported in the National Vulnerability Database but were "silently" patched by the vendors when releasing later versions of these products; in contrast, these vulnerabilities are almost entirely missed by the other vulnerability detection systems we experimented with.
papers.abstract_zh: 软件漏洞的自动检测是一个重要的研究问题。然而，该问题的现有解决方案依赖于人类专家来定义特征，并且经常遗漏许多弱点(即，导致高的假阴性率)。在本文中，我们开始研究使用基于深度学习的漏洞检测来将人类专家从手动定义特征的繁琐和主观任务中解放出来。由于深度学习的动机是处理与漏洞检测问题非常不同的问题，因此我们需要一些指导原则来将深度学习应用于漏洞检测。特别是，我们需要找到适合深度学习的软件程序的表示。为此，我们建议使用代码小工具来表示程序，然后将它们转换为向量，其中代码小工具是一些(不一定是连续的)彼此语义相关的代码行。这导致了基于深度学习的漏洞检测系统的设计和实现，称为漏洞深度啄木鸟(VulDeePecker)。为了评估VulDeePecker，我们提出了第一个用于深度学习方法的漏洞数据集。实验结果表明，与其他方法相比，VulDeePecker可以获得更少的假阴性(具有合理的假阳性)。我们进一步将VulDeePecker应用于3个软件产品(即Xen、Seamonkey和Libav ),并检测到4个漏洞，这些漏洞没有在国家漏洞数据库中报告，而是由供应商在发布这些产品的后续版本时“悄悄”修补的；相比之下，我们试验的其他漏洞检测系统几乎完全忽略了这些漏洞。
papers.title_zh: VulDeePecker:一个基于深度学习的漏洞检测系统

papers.title: Kitsune: An Ensemble of Autoencoders for Online Network Intrusion Detection
papers.authors: Yisroel Mirsky, Tomer Doitshman, Yuval Elovici, Asaf Shabtai
papers.abstract:
Neural networks have become an increasingly popular solution for network intrusion detection systems (NIDS). Their capability of learning complex patterns and behaviors make them a suitable solution for differentiating between normal traffic and network attacks. However, a drawback of neural networks is the amount of resources needed to train them. Many network gateways and routers devices, which could potentially host an NIDS, simply do not have the memory or processing power to train and sometimes even execute such models. More importantly, the existing neural network solutions are trained in a supervised manner. Meaning that an expert must label the network traffic and update the model manually from time to time. 
In this paper, we present Kitsune: a plug and play NIDS which can learn to detect attacks on the local network, without supervision, and in an efficient online manner. Kitsune's core algorithm (KitNET) uses an ensemble of neural networks called autoencoders to collectively differentiate between normal and abnormal traffic patterns. KitNET is supported by a feature extraction framework which efficiently tracks the patterns of every network channel. Our evaluations show that Kitsune can detect various attacks with a performance comparable to offline anomaly detectors, even on a Raspberry PI. This demonstrates that Kitsune can be a practical and economic NIDS.
papers.abstract_zh:
神经网络已经成为网络入侵检测系统(NIDS)日益流行的解决方案。它们学习复杂模式和行为的能力使它们成为区分正常流量和网络攻击的合适解决方案。然而，神经网络的一个缺点是训练它们需要大量的资源。许多有可能托管NIDS的网络网关和路由器设备根本没有内存或处理能力来训练甚至有时执行这样的模型。更重要的是，现有的神经网络解决方案是以监督的方式训练的。这意味着专家必须不时地标记网络流量并手动更新模型。
在本文中，我们提出了Kitsune:一个即插即用的NIDS，它可以学习检测本地网络上的攻击，无需监督，并以一种有效的在线方式。Kitsune的核心算法(KitNET)使用一组称为自动编码器的神经网络来共同区分正常和异常的交通模式。KitNET由特征提取框架支持，该框架有效地跟踪每个网络通道的模式。我们的评估表明，Kitsune可以检测各种攻击，其性能与离线异常检测器相当，甚至在Raspberry PI上也是如此。这表明，Kitsune可以是一个实用和经济的NIDS。
papers.title_zh: Kitsune:用于在线网络入侵检测的自动编码器集合

papers.title: Feature Squeezing: Detecting Adversarial Examples in Deep Neural Networks
papers.authors: Weilin Xu, David Evans, Yanjun Qi
papers.abstract: Although deep neural networks (DNNs) have achieved great success in many tasks, they can often be fooled by \emph{adversarial examples} that are generated by adding small but purposeful distortions to natural examples. Previous studies to defend against adversarial examples mostly focused on refining the DNN models, but have either shown limited success or required expensive computation. We propose a new strategy, \emph{feature squeezing}, that can be used to harden DNN models by detecting adversarial examples. Feature squeezing reduces the search space available to an adversary by coalescing samples that correspond to many different feature vectors in the original space into a single sample. By comparing a DNN model's prediction on the original input with that on squeezed inputs, feature squeezing detects adversarial examples with high accuracy and few false positives. This paper explores two feature squeezing methods: reducing the color bit depth of each pixel and spatial smoothing. These simple strategies are inexpensive and complementary to other defenses, and can be combined in a joint detection framework to achieve high detection rates against state-of-the-art attacks.
papers.abstract_zh: 尽管深度神经网络(DNNs)在许多任务中取得了巨大成功，但它们经常会被通过向自然示例添加微小但有目的的扭曲而生成的\ emph {对抗性示例}所愚弄。先前针对对抗范例的研究大多集中于改进DNN模型，但要么显示出有限的成功，要么需要昂贵的计算。我们提出了一种新的策略“emph {特征压缩}”，它可以通过检测对立的例子来强化DNN模型。特征压缩通过将对应于原始空间中许多不同特征向量的样本合并成单个样本来减少对手可用的搜索空间。通过比较DNN模型对原始输入的预测和对压缩输入的预测，特征压缩以高准确度和很少的假阳性检测对立的例子。本文探讨了两种特征压缩方法:降低每个像素的颜色位深度和空间平滑。这些简单的策略成本低廉，是对其他防御措施的补充，并且可以结合在一个联合检测框架中，以实现对最新攻击的高检测率。
papers.title_zh: 特征压缩:检测深度神经网络中的对立实例

papers.title: Trojaning Attack on Neural Networks
papers.authors: Yingqi Liu, Shiqing Ma, Yousra Aafer, Wen-Chuan Lee, Juan Zhai, Weihang Wang, Xiangyu Zhang
papers.abstract: —With the fast spread of machine learning tech- niques, sharing and adopting public machine learning models become very popular. This gives attackers many new opportunities. In this paper, we propose a trojaning attack on neural networks. As the models are not intuitive for human to understand, the attack features stealthiness. Deploying trojaned models can cause various severe consequences including endangering human lives (in applications like autonomous driving). We ﬁrst inverse the neural network to generate a general trojan trigger , and then retrain the model with reversed engineered training data to inject malicious behaviors to the model. The malicious behaviors are only activated by inputs stamped with the trojan trigger. In our attack, we do not need to tamper with the original training process, which usually takes weeks to months. Instead, it takes minutes to hours to apply our attack. Also, we do not require the datasets that are used to train the model. In practice, the datasets are usually not shared due to privacy or copyright concerns. We use ﬁve different applications to demonstrate the power of our attack, and perform a deep analysis on the possible factors that affect the attack. The results show that our attack is highly effective and efﬁcient. The trojaned behaviors can be successfully triggered (with nearly 100% possibility) without affecting its test accuracy for normal input and even with better accuracy on public dataset. Also, it only takes a small amount of time to attack a complex neuron network model. In the end, we also discuss possible defense against such attacks.
papers.abstract_zh: —随着机器学习技术的快速传播，共享和采用公共机器学习模型变得非常流行。这给了攻击者许多新的机会。本文提出了一种针对神经网络的特洛伊木马攻击。由于模型不直观，人类难以理解，攻击具有隐蔽性。部署特洛伊木马模型可能会导致各种严重后果，包括危及人类生命(在自动驾驶等应用中)。我们首先逆神经网络生成一个通用的木马触发器，然后用逆向工程的训练数据重新训练模型，将恶意行为注入模型。恶意行为仅由带有特洛伊木马触发器标记的输入激活。在我们的攻击中，我们不需要篡改原始的训练过程，这通常需要几周到几个月的时间。相反，我们需要几分钟到几小时来实施攻击。此外，我们不需要用于训练模型的数据集。在实践中，由于隐私或版权问题，数据集通常不共享。我们使用五种不同的应用程序来展示我们攻击的威力，并对影响攻击的可能因素进行深入分析。结果表明我们的攻击是高效的。特洛伊木马行为可以被成功触发(接近100%的可能性)，而不影响其对正常输入的测试精度，甚至在公共数据集上具有更好的精度。而且，攻击一个复杂的神经元网络模型只需要很少的时间。最后，我们还讨论了可能的防御方法。
papers.title_zh: 对神经网络的特洛伊木马攻击

papers.title: Broken Fingers: On the Usage of the Fingerprint API in Android
papers.authors: Antonio Bianchi, Yanick Fratantonio, Aravind Machiry, Christopher Kruegel, Giovanni Vigna, Simon Pak Ho Chung, Wenke Lee
papers.abstract: Smartphones are increasingly used for very important tasks such as mobile payments. Correspondingly, new technologies are emerging to provide better security on smartphones. One of the most recent and most interesting is the ability to recognize fingerprints, which enables mobile apps to use biometric-based authentication and authorization to protect security-sensitive operations. In this paper, we present the first systematic analysis of the fingerprint API in Android, and we show that this API is not well understood and often misused by app developers. To make things worse, there is currently confusion about which threat model the fingerprint API should be resilient against. For example, although there is no official reference, we argue that the fingerprint API is designed to protect from attackers that can completely compromise the untrusted OS. After introducing several relevant threat models, we identify common API usage patterns and show how inappropriate choices can make apps vulnerable to multiple attacks. We then design and implement a new static analysis tool to automatically analyze the usage of the fingerprint API in Android apps. Using this tool, we perform the first systematic study on how the fingerprint API is used. The results are worrisome: Our tool indicates that 53.69% of the analyzed apps do not use any cryptographic check to ensure that the user actually touched the fingerprint sensor. Depending on the specific use case scenario of a given app, it is not always possible to make use of cryptographic checks. However, a manual investigation on a subset of these apps revealed that 80% of them could have done so, preventing multiple attacks. Furthermore, the tool indicates that only the 1.80% of the analyzed apps use this API in the most secure way possible, while many others, including extremely popular apps such as Google Play Store and Square Cash, use it in weaker ways. To make things worse, we find issues and inconsistencies even in the samples provided by the official Google documentation. We end this work by suggesting various improvements to the fingerprint API to prevent some of these problematic attacks.
papers.abstract_zh: 智能手机越来越多地用于非常重要的任务，如移动支付。相应地，新技术不断涌现，为智能手机提供了更好的安全性。最近也是最有趣的一项是识别指纹的能力，这使移动应用程序能够使用基于生物特征的身份验证和授权来保护安全敏感的操作。在本文中，我们首次对Android中的指纹API进行了系统分析，我们表明该API没有得到很好的理解，并且经常被应用程序开发人员滥用。更糟糕的是，目前对于指纹API应该抵御哪种威胁模型还存在困惑。例如，尽管没有官方参考，我们认为指纹API是为了防止攻击者完全危及不受信任的操作系统。在介绍了几个相关的威胁模型后，我们确定了常见的API使用模式，并展示了不适当的选择如何使应用程序容易受到多种攻击。然后，我们设计并实现了一个新的静态分析工具，以自动分析Android应用程序中指纹API的使用情况。使用这个工具，我们对如何使用指纹API进行了第一次系统研究。结果令人担忧:我们的工具表明，53.69%的分析应用程序没有使用任何加密检查来确保用户确实触摸了指纹传感器。根据给定应用程序的特定用例场景，并不总是能够利用加密检查。然而，对这些应用程序子集的手动调查显示，其中80%的应用程序可以这样做，从而防止多次攻击。此外，该工具表明，只有1.80%的分析应用程序以最安全的方式使用该API，而其他许多应用程序，包括谷歌Play商店和Square Cash等非常受欢迎的应用程序，都以较弱的方式使用它。更糟糕的是，我们甚至在谷歌官方文档提供的样本中也发现了问题和不一致之处。我们通过建议对指纹API的各种改进来结束这项工作，以防止其中一些有问题的攻击。
papers.title_zh: 断指:Android中指纹API的使用

papers.title: K-means++ vs. Behavioral Biometrics: One Loop to Rule Them All
papers.authors: Parimarjan Negi, Prafull Sharma, Vivek Jain, Bahman Bahmani
papers.abstract: Behavioral biometrics, a field that studies patterns in an individual’s unique behavior, has been researched actively as a means of authentication for decades. Recently, it has even been adopted in many real world scenarios. In this paper, we study keystroke dynamics, the most researched of such behavioral biometrics, from the perspective of an adversary. We designed two adversarial agents with a standard accuracy convenience tradeoff: Targeted K-means++, which is an expensive, but extremely effective adversarial agent, and Indiscriminate K-means++, which is slightly less powerful, but adds no overhead cost to the attacker. With Targeted K-means++ we could compromise the security of 40-70% of users within ten tries. In contrast, with Indiscriminate K-means++, the security of 30-50% of users was compromised. Therefore, we conclude that while keystroke dynamics has potential, it is not ready for security critical applications yet. Future keystroke dynamics research should use such adversaries to benchmark the performance of the detection algorithms, and design better algorithms to foil these. Finally, we show that the K-means++ adversarial agent generalizes well to even other types of behavioral biometrics data by applying it on a dataset of touchscreen swipes.
papers.abstract_zh: 行为生物识别是一个研究个人独特行为模式的领域，几十年来一直作为一种身份认证手段受到积极研究。最近，它甚至被许多现实世界的场景所采用。在本文中，我们从对手的角度研究击键动力学，这是此类行为生物识别中研究最多的。我们设计了两个具有标准准确性和便利性权衡的对抗代理:目标K-means++是一个昂贵但非常有效的对抗代理，而无差别K-means++功能稍弱，但不会增加攻击者的开销。有了针对性的K-means++我们可以在十次尝试之内危及40-70%用户的安全。相比之下，使用不分青红皂白的K-means++时，30-50%的用户的安全性受到了损害。因此，我们的结论是，虽然击键动力学有潜力，但它还没有准备好用于安全关键应用。未来的击键动力学研究应该使用这样的对手来测试检测算法的性能，并设计更好的算法来挫败这些。最后，通过将K-means++敌对代理应用于触摸屏滑动数据集，我们证明了它甚至可以很好地推广到其他类型的行为生物特征数据。
papers.title_zh: K-means++与行为生物测定学:一个循环来统治它们

papers.title: ABC: Enabling Smartphone Authentication with Built-in Camera
papers.authors: Zhongjie Ba, Sixu Piao, Xinwen Fu, Dimitrios Koutsonikolas, Aziz Mohaisen, Kui Ren
papers.abstract: In this paper, we propose ABC, a real-time smartphone Authentication protocol utilizing the photo-response nonuniformity (PRNU) of the Built-in Camera. In contrast to previous works that require tens of images to build reliable PRNU features for conventional cameras, we are the first to observe that one image alone can uniquely identify a smartphone due to the unique PRNU of a smartphone image sensor. This new discovery makes the use of PRNU practical for smartphone authentication. While most existing hardware fingerprints are vulnerable against forgery attacks, ABC defeats forgery attacks by verifying a smartphone’s PRNU identity through a challenge response protocol using a visible light communication channel. A user captures two time-variant QR codes and sends the two images to a server, which verifies the identity by fingerprint and image content matching. The time-variant QR codes can also defeat replay attacks. Our experiments with 16,000 images over 40 smartphones show that ABC can efficiently authenticate user devices with an error rate less than 0.5%.
papers.abstract_zh: 在本文中，我们提出了一种利用内置摄像头的光响应不均匀性(PRNU)的实时智能手机认证协议ABC。与之前需要数十张图像来为传统相机建立可靠的PRNU特征的工作相比，我们首次观察到，由于智能手机图像传感器的独特PRNU，仅一张图像就可以唯一地识别智能手机。这一新发现使得PRNU在智能手机认证中的应用变得切实可行。虽然大多数现有的硬件指纹容易受到伪造攻击，但ABC通过使用可见光通信通道的挑战响应协议来验证智能手机的PRNU身份，从而击败伪造攻击。用户捕获两个时变QR码，并将这两个图像发送到服务器，服务器通过指纹和图像内容匹配来验证身份。时变QR码也可以抵御重放攻击。我们对40部智能手机上的16，000张图像进行的实验表明，ABC可以高效地验证用户设备，错误率低于0.5%。
papers.title_zh: ABC:通过内置摄像头实现智能手机认证

papers.title: Device Pairing at the Touch of an Electrode
papers.authors: Marc Roeschlin, Ivan Martinovic, Kasper Bonne Rasmussen
papers.abstract: Device pairing is the problem of having two devices securely establish a key that can be used to secure subsequent communication. The problem arises every time two devices that do not already share a secret need to bootstrap a secure communication channel. Many solutions exist, all suited to different situations, and all with their own strengths and weaknesses. In this paper, we propose a novel approach to device pairing that applies whenever a user wants to pair two devises that can be physically touched at the same time. The pairing process is easy to perform, even for novice users. A central problem for a device (Alice) running a device pairing protocol, is determining whether the other party (Bob) is in fact the device that we are supposed to establish a key with. Our scheme is based on the idea that two devices can perform device pairing, if they are physically held by the same person (at the same time). In order to pair two devices, a person touches a conductive surface on each device. While the person is in contact with both devices, the human body acts as a transmission medium for intra-body communication and the two devices can communicate through the body. This body channel is used as part of a pairing protocol which allows the devices to agree on a mutual secret and, at the same time, extract physical features to verify that they are being held by the same person. We prove that our device pairing protocol is secure in our threat model and we build a proof of concept set-up and conduct experiments with 15 people to verify the idea in practice.
papers.abstract_zh: 设备配对是指让两台设备安全地建立一个密钥，该密钥可用于确保后续通信的安全。每当两个尚未共享秘密的设备需要自举安全通信信道时，问题就出现了。存在许多解决方案，都适合不同的情况，并且都有各自的优点和缺点。在本文中，我们提出了一种新的设备配对方法，每当用户想要将两个可以同时物理触摸的设备配对时，该方法都适用。配对过程很容易执行，即使对于新手用户也是如此。运行设备配对协议的设备(Alice)的中心问题是确定另一方(Bob)实际上是否是我们应该与之建立密钥的设备。我们的方案基于这样的思想，即如果两个设备在物理上由同一个人(同时)持有，则它们可以执行设备配对。为了配对两个设备，人们触摸每个设备上的导电表面。当人与这两个设备接触时，人体充当体内通信的传输介质，并且这两个设备可以通过身体进行通信。该身体通道被用作配对协议的一部分，该协议允许设备就共同的秘密达成一致，同时提取身体特征以验证它们是由同一个人持有的。我们证明了我们的设备配对协议在我们的威胁模型中是安全的，我们建立了一个概念验证设置，并在15个人中进行了实验，以在实践中验证该想法。
papers.title_zh: 接触电极时设备配对

papers.title: Face Flashing: a Secure Liveness Detection Protocol based on Light Reflections
papers.authors: Di Tang, Zhe Zhou, Yinqian Zhang, Kehuan Zhang
papers.abstract:
Face authentication systems are becoming increasingly prevalent, especially with the rapid development of Deep Learning technologies. However, human facial information is easy to be captured and reproduced, which makes face authentication systems vulnerable to various attacks. Liveness detection is an important defense technique to prevent such attacks, but existing solutions did not provide clear and strong security guarantees, especially in terms of time. 
To overcome these limitations, we propose a new liveness detection protocol called Face Flashing that significantly increases the bar for launching successful attacks on face authentication systems. By randomly flashing well-designed pictures on a screen and analyzing the reflected light, our protocol has leveraged physical characteristics of human faces: reflection processing at the speed of light, unique textual features, and uneven 3D shapes. Cooperating with working mechanism of the screen and digital cameras, our protocol is able to detect subtle traces left by an attacking process. 
To demonstrate the effectiveness of Face Flashing, we implemented a prototype and performed thorough evaluations with large data set collected from real-world scenarios. The results show that our Timing Verification can effectively detect the time gap between legitimate authentications and malicious cases. Our Face Verification can also differentiate 2D plane from 3D objects accurately. The overall accuracy of our liveness detection system is 98.8\%, and its robustness was evaluated in different scenarios. In the worst case, our system's accuracy decreased to a still-high 97.3\%.
papers.abstract_zh:
人脸认证系统变得越来越普遍，尤其是随着深度学习技术的快速发展。然而，人脸信息容易被捕获和复制，这使得人脸认证系统容易受到各种攻击。活性检测是防止这种攻击的重要防御技术，但现有的解决方案没有提供明确和强有力的安全保证，特别是在时间方面。
为了克服这些限制，我们提出了一种新的活性检测协议，称为人脸闪烁，它大大提高了对人脸认证系统发起成功攻击的门槛。通过在屏幕上随机闪烁设计良好的图片并分析反射光，我们的协议利用了人脸的物理特征:光速的反射处理，独特的文本特征和不均匀的3D形状。配合屏幕和数码相机的工作机制，我们的协议能够检测攻击过程留下的细微痕迹。
为了证明面部闪烁的有效性，我们实现了一个原型，并使用从真实世界场景中收集的大数据集进行了全面的评估。结果表明，我们的时间验证可以有效地检测合法认证和恶意案例之间的时间差。我们的人脸验证也可以准确地区分2D平面和三维物体。我们的活性检测系统的总体准确率为98.8%，并在不同的场景下对其鲁棒性进行了评估。在最糟糕的情况下，我们的系统精度下降到仍然很高的97.3%。
papers.title_zh: 人脸闪烁:一种基于光反射的安全活性检测协议

papers.title: A Large-scale Analysis of Content Modification by Open HTTP Proxies
papers.authors: Giorgos Tsirantonakis, Panagiotis Ilia, Sotiris Ioannidis, Elias Athanasopoulos, Michalis Polychronakis
papers.abstract: Open HTTP proxies offer a quick and convenient solution for routing web traffic towards a destination. In contrast to more elaborate relaying systems, such as anonymity networks or VPN services, users can freely connect to an open HTTP proxy without the need to install any special software. Therefore, open HTTP proxies are an attractive option for bypassing IPbased filters and geo-location restrictions, circumventing content blocking and censorship, and in general, hiding the client’s IP address when accessing a web server. Nevertheless, the consequences of routing traffic through an untrusted third party can be severe, while the operating incentives of the thousands of publicly available HTTP proxies are questionable. In this paper, we present the results of a large-scale analysis of open HTTP proxies, focusing on determining the extent to which user traffic is manipulated while being relayed. We have designed a methodology for detecting proxies that, instead of passively relaying traffic, actively modify the relayed content. Beyond simple detection, our framework is capable of macroscopically attributing certain traffic modifications at the network level to well-defined malicious actions, such as ad injection, user fingerprinting, and redirection to malware landing pages. We have applied our methodology on a large set of publicly available HTTP proxies, which we monitored for a period of two months, and identified that 38% of them perform some form of content modification. The majority of these proxies can be considered benign, as they do not perform any harmful content modification. However, 5.15% of the tested proxies were found to perform modification or injection that can be considered as malicious or unwanted. Specifically, 47% of the malicious proxies injected ads, 39% injected code for collecting user information that can be used for tracking and fingerprinting, and 12% attempted to redirect the user to pages that contain malware. Our study reveals the true incentives of many of the publicly available web proxies. Our findings raise several concerns, as we uncover multiple cases where users can be severely affected by connecting to an open proxy. As a step towards protecting users against unwanted content modification, we built a service that leverages our methodology to automatically collect and probe public proxies, and generates a list of safe proxies that do not perform any content modification, on a daily basis.
papers.abstract_zh: 开放式HTTP代理为将web流量路由到目的地提供了一种快速方便的解决方案。与更复杂的中继系统(如匿名网络或VPN服务)相比，用户可以自由地连接到一个开放的HTTP代理，而无需安装任何特殊的软件。因此，对于绕过基于ip的过滤器和地理位置限制、规避内容封锁和审查，以及通常在访问web服务器时隐藏客户端的IP地址，开放HTTP代理是一个有吸引力的选择。然而，通过不受信任的第三方路由流量的后果可能是严重的，而数以千计的公开可用的HTTP代理的操作动机是值得怀疑的。在本文中，我们展示了对开放HTTP代理进行大规模分析的结果，重点是确定用户流量在被中继时被操纵的程度。我们设计了一种检测代理的方法，它不是被动地转发流量，而是主动修改转发的内容。除了简单的检测，我们的框架还能够在宏观上将网络级别的某些流量修改归因于定义明确的恶意操作，如广告注入、用户指纹识别和重定向到恶意软件登录页面。我们已经将我们的方法应用于大量公开可用的HTTP代理，我们对其进行了两个月的监控，发现其中38%的代理执行了某种形式的内容修改。这些代理中的大多数可以被认为是良性的，因为它们不执行任何有害的内容修改。然而，5.15%的测试代理被发现执行可被视为恶意或不必要的修改或注入。具体来说，47%的恶意代理注入了广告，39%的恶意代理注入了用于收集可用于跟踪和指纹识别的用户信息的代码，12%的恶意代理试图将用户重定向到包含恶意软件的页面。我们的研究揭示了许多公开网络代理的真正动机。我们的发现提出了几个问题，因为我们发现了多个用户可能因连接到开放代理而受到严重影响的案例。作为保护用户免受不必要的内容修改的一步，我们构建了一个服务，利用我们的方法来自动收集和探测公共代理，并每天生成一个不执行任何内容修改的安全代理列表。
papers.title_zh: 开放HTTP代理对内容修改的大规模分析

papers.title: Measuring and Disrupting Anti-Adblockers Using Differential Execution Analysis
papers.authors: Shitong Zhu, Xunchao Hu, Zhiyun Qian, Zubair Shafiq, Heng Yin
papers.abstract: Millions of people use adblockers to remove intrusive and malicious ads as well as protect themselves against tracking and pervasive surveillance. Online publishers consider adblockers a major threat to the ad-powered “free” Web. They have started to retaliate against adblockers by employing antiadblockers which can detect and stop adblock users. To counter this retaliation, adblockers in turn try to detect and filter anti-adblocking scripts. This back and forth has prompted an escalating arms race between adblockers and anti-adblockers. We want to develop a comprehensive understanding of antiadblockers, with the ultimate aim of enabling adblockers to bypass state-of-the-art anti-adblockers. In this paper, we present a differential execution analysis to automatically detect and analyze anti-adblockers. At a high level, we collect execution traces by visiting a website with and without adblockers. Through differential execution analysis, we are able to pinpoint the conditions that lead to the differences caused by anti-adblocking code. Using our system, we detect anti-adblockers on 30.5% of the Alexa top10K websites which is 5-52 times more than reported in prior literature. Unlike prior work which is limited to detecting visible reactions (e.g., warning messages) by anti-adblockers, our system can discover attempts to detect adblockers even when there is no visible reaction. From manually checking one third of the detected websites, we find that the websites that have no visible reactions constitute over 90% of the cases, completely dominating the ones that have visible warning messages. Finally, based on our findings, we further develop JavaScript rewriting and API hooking based solutions (the latter implemented as a Chrome extension) to help adblockers bypass state-of-the-art anti-adblockers.
papers.abstract_zh: 数百万人使用广告拦截器来删除入侵和恶意广告，并保护自己免受跟踪和无处不在的监视。在线出版商认为广告拦截器是广告驱动的“免费”网络的主要威胁。他们已经开始通过使用反广告拦截器来报复广告拦截器，反广告拦截器可以检测和阻止广告拦截器用户。为了应对这种报复，广告拦截器反过来试图检测和过滤反广告拦截脚本。这种反复促使广告拦截器和反广告拦截器之间的军备竞赛不断升级。我们希望对抗广告阻断剂有一个全面的了解，最终目标是使广告阻断剂绕过最先进的抗广告阻断剂。在本文中，我们提出了一种差分执行分析来自动检测和分析反广告拦截器。在高层次上，我们通过访问带有和不带有广告拦截器的网站来收集执行跟踪。通过差异执行分析，我们能够查明导致防广告阻塞代码差异的条件。使用我们的系统，我们在30.5%的Alexa top10K网站上检测到了反广告拦截器，这是之前文献报道的5-52倍。与限于检测抗广告阻断剂的可见反应(例如，警告消息)的先前工作不同，我们的系统可以发现检测广告阻断剂的尝试，即使没有可见反应。通过人工检查三分之一的被检测网站，我们发现没有明显反应的网站占了90%以上，完全占据了有明显警告信息的网站。最后，基于我们的发现，我们进一步开发了基于JavaScript重写和API挂钩的解决方案(后者作为Chrome扩展实现)，以帮助广告拦截器绕过最先进的反广告拦截器。
papers.title_zh: 使用差异执行分析测量和干扰抗广告阻断剂

papers.title: Towards Measuring the Effectiveness of Telephony Blacklists
papers.authors: Sharbani Pandit, Roberto Perdisci, Mustaque Ahamad, Payas Gupta
papers.abstract: Presented on February 9, 2018 at 12:00 p.m. in the Klaus Advanced Computing Building, Room 1116W.
